Two weeks ago I started passing my 3rd stone ever. The first two came out after hours of pain years ago, but this one got stuck in my ureter for almost two weeks. It was caused from hyperparathyroidism. Body making to much calcium. I advise anyone making large amounts of kidney stones or even just one to have pth and calcium levels checked. I had a fluctuating calcium level so I was hard to diagnose. I used my gut feeling and went to Norman Parathyroid Center in Florida and sure enough I had a large tumor on my parathyroid. I had one parathyroid removed. A lot of doctors ignore a high calcium level or recheck and it's normal the next time so they think you don't have a problem when you do. The truth is it can be fluctuating and causing you to have a kidney stone problem. Have your calcium and pth checked a few times not just a couple and see where it is. If you are over 40 and your calcium level is over 10, you are having issues. Your calcium level for your age should be 9-9.5 never over 10. Quit suffering and take the bull by it's horns and take care of the main problem.

I have had kidney stones for over 30 years.  I've had multiple surgeries.  My urologist calls me a stone farmer because I have them so often.  Mine is the result of inverted horseshoe kidneys which cause my kidneys not to drain.  I drink lots of liquids (about 1.5 gallons a day) to help keep the stones at a minimum but I still have lots of stones.  Started taking Chanca Piedra and it has helped me with pain.  I always have stones so I have to wait to have another test to see if it has reduced any stones in size or quantity but it does help my pain and it seems to make me void more, which could also help people with high blood pressure and type 2 diabetes.  
Always check with your doctor and a nutritionalist.

column6: I am a 48 year old male and i've had stones since i was in 2nd grade. I've probably passed a hundred stones in my lifetime from the size of grain of sand to a small bullet. For the last ten years or so I generally did not have the agonizing pain associated with stones, but it was replaced with a dull ache that would linger for up to a month and would be triggered by any kind of physical activity. Even walking through the grocery store would set it off. I had a cat scan and it showed 'multiple' stones (generally meaning too many to count) and one very large one that was sitting right at the base of the kidney and potentially move around and block urinary flow. I was going to have lithotripsy again but the doctor was going to force me to have a stent which i don't need due to the size of the stones i've passed my whole life. I bought Stone Breaker off of Amazon and it has literally changed my life. I don't even take it every day, just when I start to feel any kind of burning, pain or any kind of disruption with my urine. I never passed any stone fragments and my urine did not appear cloudy as some of the reviews claimed. All I can say is that the lingering ache that plagued me for years is now gone. I can't believe it's a coincidence. Not sure if it changes the PH of my urine or what. I would be very curious to have another imaging of my kidneys done to see if that large stone is gone or has shrunk in size. One of the very few times in life when I've been pleasantly surprised by a product like this.

column6: I can't believe this actually worked, but it did! I have been plagued by kidney stones for the past 4 years, when I was diagnosed with innumerable kidney stones in both kidneys. I read so many reviews from people who claimed it worked that I figured I'd try it; I had nothing to lose except $30. column6: I am temporarily using tamsulosin (Flomax) to aid in passing kidney stone fragments following shock wave lithotripsy on one kidney. The medication has been successful in relaxing the bladder neck muscle and prostate to allow the stone fragments to pass without pain. However, men should note the possible sexual side effects. I have experienced retrograde ejaculation. The initial sensation of orgasm feels pleasurable, but the intense pressure of seminal fluid collecting in the urethra before ejaculation doesn't happen. Instead, the relaxed muscles allow the semen to flow backward into the bladder. Ejaculation happens, but there is not a series of strong muscle contractions nor pleasurable feelings of release. I experience a few weak pulses and a few drops of semen (or none at all) ooze from my penis, even though my hips instinctively flex like a normal ejaculation. Fortunately, I've felt no discomfort when semen goes into the bladder, just a subtle feeling of congestion that is relieved later during urination. Overall, sexual satisfaction seems diminished by 50%. No issues with achieving an erection or responding to stimulation to reach the start of orgasm, but I've had to adjust to the physical and mental dissatisfaction with the lack of ejaculation. If you are using Flomax for an extended period of time, you may want to discuss these issues with your partner, if you have one

I have severe anxiety and recently diagnosed with a thyroid issue. I am stressed daily and this was recommended. My stress levels improved but I was unaware that it had major side effects with anxiety and thyroid medication. This landed me in the ER with a blood pressure of 60/45 and feeling awful. I also started to have migraines which again because it was all natural I chalked it up to stress. I believe it's also made me not interested in the things I once was and asked my doctor to put me on an antidepressant due to it. After reading both good and bad reviews I'm chalking it up to the Ashwagandha. I'm taking a break from it to see if symptoms improve.

-Brand: LadrÃ´me Ashwagandha Bio (tincture)
-Dose they recommend: Daily max. 50 drops, or 1.31 g of extract (1310 mg)
-Dose I used: Started with 15-20 drops twice a day, reduced to 5-8 drops once a day.
-Reasons for taking the tincture: Hormonal imbalance, anxiety, insomnia, to boost the immune system.
-My experience so far: The first days I took about 15-20 drops twice a day. My anxiety seemed to worsten about an hour after taking the tincture, this would luckily slowly fade away but I did feel foggy, a bit numbed and depressed and nauseous throughout the day (I almost never get nauseous, so this was strange to me). Positive thing was that I did sleep like a baby but the downside was that I had a really hard time getting out of bed in the mornings. 
So after a few days I decided tot lower the dosage to about 10 drops twice a day. The foggy and numbed feeling stayed and made me feel insecure about my daily tasks so I decided to only take the tincture before bedtime. The deep sleep was wonderful, but I kept feeling so tired in the morning, it took me hours to feel a bit alert and I didn't like the light feeling of nausea that I remained as well, so again I lowered the dosage to only 5-8 drops once a day (before sleep). 
This seemed to work for me, as I was sleeping alright (not as deep as with the higher dosage though). I didn't feel nauseous, although it did still reduce my appetite and my anxiety and feelings of light depression would fade as well. I seemed to function fine during the day and my symptoms of PMS seemed to decrease. In general I felt good with this dosage. Especially because it seemed to balance my hormones (no mood swings, no swollen glands before my period, no increased susceptibility to allergy). 
In the description of this tincture it says to stop using it after three weeks. I decided to stop for 2-3 weeks (reducing the dosage to only 3 drops the last 3 days). After this pause I will start again with the dosage of max 8 drops a day before sleep and see how that goes. At this moment I have stopped taking the tincture for four days and didn't notice any big withdrawal symptoms. Although unfortunately I do have some trouble with sleeping again. Because there are so many warnings about this plant medicine, along with soms really bad experiences, I'm rather careful with using it. The way it made me feel in the beginning also made me cautious.

Presently I'm taking one 1500mg capsule with a mid-morning meal. This is down from the three capsules daily (one after meals, and at bedtime). My endocrinologist recommended âashwagandaâ To âlowerâ my cortisol levels which were high. He wanted me to take 3 of the Gaia Ashwaganda gummies so that is 1,800mg. Every day for 3 months. I started in February. The second week of April, I noticed some âgastrointestinalâ issues I had random nausea throughout that week. My appetite was disappearing and then the weekend of April 12. I had the most random panic attack. I have not had panic attacks in YEARS! And then that's when I started noticing heightening anxiety now I do have anxiety, but this was different. This was more intrusive anxiety! That Monday 4/15 I woke up SICK like if I was poisoned. Aggressive vomiting, nausea, shakes, elevated heart rate, feeling like my blood sugar was crashing. This was how I was that Monday though 4/19. I went to the ER because I didn't eat that week, I honestly felt like I was dying & my anxiety was the worse it's been like it was just 24/7 & intrusive at that point. The ER told me I was severely dehydrated & kept monitoring my heart. I tried to convince him that maybe this was just all anxiety related, but they disagreed. They were concerned about my stomach and the symptoms I was experiencing they had to put me on a few IV bags. They didn't want to release me, but they wanted to see how I felt at home after medicating me and putting me on the IVs. But they did tell me to stop the supplement! I didn't think anything of it at the time I was like it's a natural supplement shouldn't be an issue, but I was wrong. Unfortunately there is withdrawal symptoms and they can last weeks longer from all the thorough research. I have been doing thorough research has brought to my knowledge that this supplement is very toxic. I'm not the only one who  has experienced these issues! It's been almost a month since I stopped to supplement and I am still dealing with crippling intrusive anxiety. It's there every day I still have a very sensitive stomach. I am not depressed, but I just feel like I've lost desire and the things that I love and in my own work! I am a full time entrepreneur so imagine how I feel! Heart always seems elevated, I get fainty a lot. I'm tired all the time & do not feel like myself which makes me feel hopeless. I am stressing if my brain will ever bounce back from thisâ¦ it did lower my cortisol levels but the as it worth it? NO. I did check my thyroid, my vitamin d, copper levels (ashwaganda contains copper), magnesium everything came back normal. Ashwaganda just really affected me :( STAY AWAY FROM IT.

I always read the reviews at WebMD with a grain of salt. People are as different as the colors of a rainbow. Everyone's experience will be different according to their personal chemistry and the things they eat and so on. So it was that I thought about trying this ashwagandha with an open mind, as it claims to reduce stress and improve sleep. Of course, coming to WebMD, I checked out what people were saying both positive and negative. I remembered people reporting that they would have strange dreams and suicidal thoughts.

So it was very disturbing to me that the very first time I used it to calm down after I had a rather stressful day, in the middle of the night I woke up having a rather vivid and unusual dream. After waking up but still in bed, I thought of what might happen if something terrible happened and my mind got around to thinking of suicide! I don't think that way, so it stood out in my mind and then I remembered the reviews of ashwagandha that reported these very same symptoms!

It was just too much of a coincidence for me to write it off.  Coming back here, my memory was verified. In my older years, I've been checking out various supplements. Some of them are quite good! But it's very few that comes with a warning about these things and I just wanted to add my name to a list of people having these symptoms. 

I'm not saying this product might not work for everyone. Everyone's chemistry is different and it's possible that there are people who might gain benefit from this. I'm not one of them! I'm simply not taking this again to find out if things "smooth out" or anything like that! I'm passing along my experience and throwing this bottle out!
My liver end spleen doubled in size!

I took powder ashwagandha from a month  because I had anxiety disorder . At the beginning it was very hard as I felt vomiting and stomach issues but later on I changed my routine. I started taking after meals so there was no any issues about vomiting and stomach. I am feeling better as everyone said it is too early to say results but I was not able to sleep well now I can do better

I have has insomnia since i weaned myself off of zanex in 2020. Tuning forks and vibrational tuning energy has help a lot so I am not staring at the ceiling for hours, and so has castor oil packs - deeper sleep even in just the two to three hours window of my first hours before I wake up - I then am awake for 2-3 on and off and then can get back to sleep after that time.   

I read about ashwagandha "Powder" helping with sleep and I so happen to have some on my shelf (old but okay) - have my on supplement store in my house - lol - due to my mom's way of raising us)  so I thought I would give it a go.  WOW - amazing!!! - I slept most of the night - waking on and off, but going RIGHT BACK TO SLEEP!!! - This is what I fight every night and is HUGE for me and the last 3+ years of trying to find something that would help me sleep and sleep through my hot flashes instead of wake me up. 

So I took it two night and it was GREAT!, but I do feel sluggish in the morning - kind of drugged feeling. Then forgot for a couple of nights - and back to the waking up hours in the middle of my sleep. Then remembered again - and took the last two nights - and bam - sleeping through the night with waking up, but very easily getting back to sleep instead of tossing and turning for hours. For me this is a miracle - It is Jarrow which is a good brand from my experiences, and it is a powder not a capsule and tablets are terrible -hard and hard to ger broken down and used - also more crap in tablets usually. Will keeep taking - will have to see if it wear off over a few months.  I have taken vitamins my WHOLE LIFE - as my mom was into health and we were raised that way starting in the 50's and 60's- she was reading and listening to nutritionists

I was actually using the Ashwagandha in NUTRAHARMONY's complex, Irish Sea Moss supplement with Ashwagandha 1000 mg. I have to tell you, the results were not very fast to appear. Maybe it's just my experience. But in 2-3 months, I felt less anxious and more energized throughout the day, and my husband noticed that I slept much better at night. I used to talk at night and be low in mood for months post-COVID.  Overall, my experience with the supplement is positive. Hope they make it into liquid drops sometime.

I took two capsules for the first use and my stomach aches and totally sick on my stomach. I am unable to sleep. Ashwamag is a terrible supplement. Should've read reviews before this purchase. What an expensive waste.
Only took one and woke at midnight to non stopping vomiting for about 5 hours. Never taking it again

The supplement industry is highly unregulated so beware where and what you buy.  I could imagine reading these highly disparate reviews, this is an issue along with getting the right dosage level.  Watched videos on a ashwaganda in youtube.  

I'm taking Costco 500MG for a few weeks and very pleased.  Feel a little mild calm over-relaxed dopy tire feel, like you took a very mild opiodal or something.  No stomach issues.  only think I'm watching is my urination seems slowed down (guy 61).  I'm experimenting with one AM and one at bed for insomnia and high cortisol/stress.  So far it's really good.  I'll probably back off to once/day at night and or lower the dosage and try to find the minimum dosage I can take while yielding what I'm after.  Cuz, it's helping a ton.

Literally just like taking a Xanax or Ativan. 

Contains the exact same ingredients of pain killers, anxiety pills, and sleep pills all rolled into a brown capsule of dried plant.

It's wonderful for anxiety and insomnia- but it's not something to play with!
Ashwagandha has been extremely effective in lowering my blood pressure, very effective lowering my stress levels. Gives me a sense of calmness. No side effects has been noticed.

Very good supplement. It gives me vigor. I don't get as tired from stress as I used to. I can do a lot of things throughout the day. It is not an stimulant, It is more like you don't get too tired from stress. For those Who have severe side efects from herbs like Ashwagandha, Rhodiola, Eleuthero and such,     don't forget they may interact with medicines. Good luck.

I took one capsule then two hours later I was vomiting, my stomach bloated and then diarreha ,
spent most of the evening in the bathroom.this product might work different on other people but it is not one for me, through the rest in the trash bin.

Initially I took this as needed at night to help me sleep, it worked very well at making me drowsy.   Sometimes I would take it to calm me down after a particularly anxiety-producing incident, also worked very well for this.  I have been taking Prozac, but the efficacy was starting to wane, so I decided to try taking the ashwaganda daily.  This was less than 2 weeks ago, so it's too soon to say on that count.  I have never experienced any side effects and am actually quite surprised at some of the reviews.  Dosage is just 460 mg as needed.

I started supplementing with ashwagandha at the advice of a few people to ease everyday anxiety and low mood. It worked great for the first few days, but after a week or so I experienced emotional blunting, brain fog and wild mood swings. I cycled off, then back on again and the same feelings came back paired with borderline paranoia. I would advise being very careful with this stuff as I guess it affects people in different ways. It isn't for everyone

I tried Ashwagandha for anxiety and felt terrible, I only took two capsules over two days, I had stomach pain and felt like I would be sick, I felt panicky and strange, I also had a panic attack, I'd never had a panic attack before and even though I only took two capsules I had a panic attack again two weeks later!

This has helped me tremendously post covid.  I've dealt with post covid anxiety, and long term covid issues(everything on the list).  It seems when i take this my joint pain is way less and anxiety way less, and i just feel better overall....I've been taking it about 2 years now, usually a 300mg gumy in the am and at lunch.  And then a tablet at bed time(300mg).

As a man, I noticed a great upgrade in my libido. More energy during my day. With a higher dose, I can definetly feel the substance in my body giving me energy to go through the day. Also take during a meal to avois stomach upset. Did not notice a change in my anxiety however, I think? Try it for yourself, everyone's body reacts differently.

After three days I went from high blood pressure to low. I had to cut my blood pressure pills in half. But I will mention I was also dieting and working out more. And I have lost a few pounds. IF I can get off blood pressure altogether, that would be awesome.

on my 3rd bottle (90 caps of 450 mg) usually i take twice daily one after breakfast/lunch and one after dinner . Taking 3 times when needed.

i struggle with high anxiety , uncontrolled anger esp. during PMS and also insomnia

This helped me alot. centered my emotions, clearer mindset, more focused, helped to be more calm and collected when confronted with triggering situations and sleep was better

no other side effects noted in my experience ( with maximum dose of 450 mg x 3 daily )

I've found this supplement extremely effective. So much so that I only take two tablets when I want novel effects for just one day. The most noticeable effect is a quieting of the mind. I feel more sleepy, more comfy, but not tiered, not low energy, just cool and collected â everything comes to me in a timely manner and I want to cuddle people.

My satisfaction is somewhat lower than the effectiveness as though it clearly has a good effect on anxiety, it also decreases my desire to talk and share passionately â which I also love. So though it makes me very comfortable in the room with many people, I cease to be life of the party â though that wasn't happening anyway.

I simply reserve this analog for when I want a different colour spilled over the day. A fantastic novel effect which can help stimulate the fulfilment of your week.

I tried a 150mg ksm-66 gummy. I ate it around 4:30pm. By 5:15 I was feeling some heaviness in my chest and my legs were more wobbly than with my everyday anxiety. By 6:30 I had lost my appetite, felt shaky, and had been in my bathroom peeing for 45minutes. Its now 915 and I feel nausea (been feeling like I was going to puke at any moment) and feeling a little more tired from it all. Hopefully I will get over all this soon!

I have been taking it for about 3 months and it has had the most amazing effect on treating my chronic anxiety and burnout. I have started by taking 800mg/day and now I can do with 400mg/day. I have suggested it to everyone I know and all of them speak highly of it, as if it's some kind of miracle treatment. Well, for me it is! 

Just a FYY, if you have gastrointestinal issues such as acid reflux, gerd, stomach ulcers, you might want to take only 400mg/day and on a full stomach, otherwise it might cause some discomfort. 
Not sure about taking it longterm, I haven't had issues with it and I know someone that's been taking it for over a year with the same positive results. Might just be a case of "there are not any proper long-term studies on its effects". Good luck!
these gummies made me so sick. I've been throwing up at night within an hour of taking them.

I started supplementing with a powder in my coffee, in an attempt to help balance my body from an array of symptoms relating to hormonal imbalance when recovering from stopping hormonal birth control nearly 2 years ago. I took a powder from a health food store. Unfortunately it has taken me over a year to connect the dots and realize the ashwaghanda I incorporated into my natural treatments was then the culprit of some of the very symptoms I was trying to combat. Namely: low/no sex drive, being completely emotionally numb, extreme fatigue, debililtating brainfog. I will say it can lower anxiety, but along with this lowers my ability to feel any emotion at all and during acute stage I felt like a complete zombie, and had zero motivation. This affects so many hormones (is GABAergic, serotonergic, dopaminergic, affects your sex hormones, drastically lowers cortisol) The strong effect on all of this resulted in persistent and impactful imbalance eg: you really, really need cortisol..at the correct levels, to feel motivated and content emotionally) Yes I cycled it, and took half a teaspoon on the days I had it, a common recommendation. It wasn't til I restocked and commenced a new cycle nearly every day for 3 weeks (in January this year) that I noticed something was really, really wrong.. It does not work well with my, and many others' bodies. I have now been 2.5 months off so far and the extreme fatigue, brainfog, demotivation, and feeling dead inside have subsided (they were practically debilitating and I have lost a lot of my life to this supplement making me sick). I am becoming much more alert, my menstrual cycle is no longer extremely short like 21 days, I still can't feel all my emotions, nor is my sex drive working and that is significant, beyond having sex. Sexual energy is a life force, the feeling of embodiment. Whereas I am dissociated. I am 30 and know myself very, very well and this is distinctly an imbalance my body/brain are trying to recover from- my thoughts themselves are not negative. I literally can't feel my emotions. This really is not for everyone, please be careful and know that as an ayurvedic herb act very differently on each person depending on their energetic/biological make up and it would be best assessed and monitored by a qualified practitioner of herbal medicine. The consistency of use may also vary a lot per person, IF you're suited to use it, Too many people take this with bare minimum information. It is a drug, and it can have significant, lasting effects that are very detrimental. Be very careful

Took 1 concentrated 125 mg dose. Within 12 hours I began having a pretty bad stomach ache. 5 hours later I was throwing up. I couldn't sleep that night because my heart rate was abnormally high. 0/10 do not recommend, or at least, be very cautious

I was having a slight case of Anxiety due to job related issues, so I decided to look up a mood enhancing suplement online. That's when I ran into a company selling Ashwagandha on Amazon. The first day I took this I did not feel anything at all. It sort of reminded me of St. John Wort the bottle which has been sitting on my shelf for 5 years with minimal use except as a Placebo. In any case, I didn't want to give up, so I took it for another few days. By the 4th day my Anxiety had become more accute. I also had problems sleeping. It was like my mind was racing and I could not crontrol the recurring thoughts. I actually felt Synapses and Neurons going off in my brain like a July 4th fire-works celebration ! This is the second (and definitely the last time time) I had this reaction with Ashwagandha. At least the St Johns Wort didn't keep me from sleeping. This supplement is just not for me ..
Notice a marked difference in anxiety levels when taking as directed.  When taken anxiety level is greatly reduced.

BEWARE OF ASHWAGANDHA if you have autoimmune issues or take blood pressure medication.  I spent 1 1/2 years suffering long haul covid symptoms of light headedness and fatigue but finally got better.  Many supplements that I've been taking may have helped me.  I received a free, unsolicited bottle of Ashwagandha in the mail from a supplier of another supplement that I was using.  I happened to open the package at the time I was taking my other supplements so thought that I would try it.  Within fifteen minutes of taking it, I got light headed and this lasted through the day and now into the next morning as I write this. I also have fatigue.  I later saw on WebMD that you should avoid Ashwagandha if you have autoimmune issues or take blood pressure medication (which both apply to me).  I am very concerned that Ashwagandha has resurrected my long haul covid symptoms and dearly hope that this is just temporary.

While it may be a placebo effect, I do feel different after starting a daily regime of 4400mg of Ashwagandha in gummy form along with regular daily vitamins and my daily prescribed 80mg of Adderal. I did experience stomach discomfort at the end of the first week at a 4400mg dosage, reduced it to a 2200mg daily dosage for 7 days, which eliminated the stomach problems, then returned to 4400mg without further problems. I feel clearer, more positive, and more energized with the Ashwagandha supplementing my Rx and daily vitamins, and I do notice a difference if I skip them in the morning.
I stopped being cranky and moody and tired

2 days 2 doses. 

Blood pressure fell to 103/60
Had no energy
Was miserable all day
Lips, throat and mouth swelled.
Hot flushes
Rattled
Slow speech
Slow thinking
Spaces out


Terrible experience that took a further 2 to 3 days to fully recover from.

Was using: 
vitamin D3
Ginseng
B complex

At the time with ashwaganda
column41: low blood pressure,fatigue,swelling,hot flushes,slow speech,slow thinking

column6: Started taking ashwaganda for anxiety, after 3 weeks of use I sleep much better, my hormones got much better, even my blood pressure, I'm 42 years old tried to get pregnant for years and after I started taking it with 42 I got pregnant, crazy , but I know was the ashwaganda
Caused me extreme nausea, vomiting and diarrhea.  Started with capsules 3000 MG, thought it must be too high dosage. Switched to 1500 MG gummies, same effect.  I am unable to tolerate it.

I started very slowly on liquid ashwaganda, just a few drops. We were boating and heading into a remote area. Just a few drops and my anxious thoughts disappeared. I was able to enjoy myself. I have been adjusting my dosage up over a few years. I love the liquid for instant results, but have started taking Herbamama capsules 750 mg for longer lasting effects. (Amazon) I am able to travel and not be anxious. Life changing for me. I do find that I am not as sharp when taking Ashwaganda, so I only take as needed, not everyday. I love that I can rely on a natural remedy and not prescription drugs. No side effects, haven't had a bad experience.

Could this be serotonin syndrome? I've been having trouble falling asleep lately despite meds I've taken for a long time for depression/anxiety, so decided to try adding Ashwaganda, since it was reported to calm a racing mind. Took 300 mg in gummy form (Walgreens), and it's had the OPPOSITE effect. I feel anxious, jittery, my mind won't stop racing and I've barely had 2 hrs sleep in 48 hours. I wonder if it interacts with my SSRI to cause serotonin syndrome? I'm stopping it right away and hope it clears my system soon so I can get some sleep! Be very cautious with this if you are taking other meds for psychiatric conditions.

Naturepath  suggested Ashwagandha to help with menopause issues and I have never been so sick in my life. Vomiting for hours - gave it the benefit of the doubt and waited a few weeks and tried again only to be worse than the first time. Vomited for hours.  After googling found out that if you have a thryoid issue DO NOT TAKE.  I was so sick.

I take this four times daily along with my prescribed meds as an add on for my Valium until I see my psychiatrist. I haven't noticed a huge difference yet but I've heard it can take awhile. The first time I tried it it made me panicky but I haven't noticed anything this time besides very very slight sedation and a bit less stress than usual. 
Hoping this evens me out more as time goes on. The gummies taste really good. I take 600mg 4 times a day.

I started taking this for two things, sleep and anxiety. And it worked for me for both! I am taking Life Extension Optimized Ashwagandha which has 10% withanolide. I take per the instructions, 1 2x/day. I have much less anxiety!! And I was in fight or flight for most of the last 8 years which I'm working on.

I been taking ashwagandha at night before I goes to bed for two day this herbal is so powerful it make you feel brand new the next day and with a lot of energy and it calm you down and very relaxing it like depression left my body I am able to focus more I don't take two only one 500mg amen

I'm an active person who likes to train early morning and late night. I started taking ashwaganda as I heard it naturally boost testosterone, but I would say it's don't the opposite. I'm 40 days in for 40 tablets of 500mg and my sex drive has plummeted which is unheard of for me and I'm struggling to get up and find motivation to do anything. I do suffer with my mental state and find gym helps me manage it, but this stuff it sending me backwards not forward. Perhaps it's too early days, so I will see the course out as have abbot 20 more tablets left

Using it for more than 6 months now. Less stress,sleep better,less pain.So far best brand is ancient nutrition 1/2 pill per day. Ran out and bought Goli brand...NEVER again it was super strong and caused me to be sleepy. Pick your brand wisley and start with a low dose.

I've always had anxiety and stress issues. I finally dropped Citalopram as I prefer more herbal remedies vs man made in lab. When I started taking about a week ago, I immediately felt more energetic (focused), stress has been easier to manage and overall better feeling each day. One downside I've noticed is that I do sweat more even when doing nothing as if I'm really nervous but I'm not. I will continue for a month to see what happens.

I have had seizures off and on, one about 12 mths to 18ths for 5 yrs.  I have tried 12 different seizure medications and couldn't tolerate any of them.  I decide to try a herb and found that ashwagandha for stress and anxiety and decided to try it.  It has worked great.  I started seeing a therapist to figure out what was going on and she diagnosed me with conversion disorder which is extreme stress and anxiety.   I did try an anxiety prescription and it made my anxiety fill like it was out the roof.  I am happy with Ashwagandha.  I only take 350 mg a day.   Gaia ashwagandha root capsules

I am a 26yo caucasian male in the US. Ashwagandha has been a great remedy for me. I was interested in the stated results of reducing stress, anxiety, and increasing sexual function and testosterone support. I found Young Theory KSM-66 500mg capsules at my local Costco, though I had seen the Goji-brand gummies as well. I chose the capsule form as it better fits into my supplement routine. I would say it's been the better part of a year now, consuming most days out of the week on average, but aimed for daily consumption. I will say that I have noticed a pleasant increase in my libido, and certainly a reduction in my stress and anxiety, though not tremendous. I would consider this to be a supplement to mildly calm oneself through the day and help maintain a more level head. The best results I have seen in my time consuming is when I am stacking it with eating well most days out of the week, and occasional to regular exercise. I will add that I have not struggled with regular sickness as well, thanks to the added immune support. My only exception to this is when I became sick with COVID-19 at the height of the pandemic -- of course, I can't and won't speak to any of its effects with COVID-19 as there have not been any studies done as of today that can speak on its effectiveness to combat or prevent it. But in regard to the common cold, flu, etc, it has been incredibly effective at keeping me healthy day-to-day.
Reading some of the other reviews here, I've noticed an apparent trend that the folks that have taken Ashwagandha in gummy form have not had a great experience, so I'm unsure if different forms of the root have anything to do with its efficacy, but thought I would mention it if anyone can attest to this.
Ultimately, I have had a wonderful experience taking Ashwagandha and will continue to utilize it. My current primary form of consumption is through the BPN Super Greens powder, which contains 300mg of KSM-66 per serving, which is less than my average dose, but I do have the capsules with me in the event I feel as though I need to up my daily dose.
This is by FAR the worst product on the shelves. I had abnormal bleeding for 13 days from this product, was scared for my LIFE. Do not take this!!!!!!!

I used to take cbd but even after using the high dosage, the ease from my anxiety wore off and it actually made me feel worse. With cbd, I felt an immediate sense of calm. I decided to try ashwagandha after cbd stopped working. Ashwagandha is very different but in a good way. I've noticed that I'm just naturally less anxious. It's not an "I need to take this right now" kind of feeling but more if a change in my biology. I don't feel like I'm relying upon a substance to calm me down. It is helping my relationship tremendously and I hope it continues to work for me.

Started taking Ashwagandha  4 days ago for anxiety. I take 250mg in the morning. My anxiety returns in early afternoon and I take another 250mg and then I am good for the rest of the day. I used to have a drink of alcohol to relieve the anxiety but that doesn't work long enough unless you have another drink or two during the day and then you're dealing with the negative effects of too much alcohol. 
After taking Ashwagandha I have no cravings for alcohol am not drinking any. This is truly working great for me and I hope this continues. I am much more calm and the little things that used to bother me I seem to handle well and I remain calm. My mind is clear and sharp and I have slept well.

Struggle with anxiety that causes insomnia and other issues. Ashwagandha has been a game changer for me. I sleep better, no mid night wake ups,  my mood has improved dramatically,  and triggers that would normally put me into a depressive/anxiety spiral no longer occur.

I work in an incredibly stressful environment and since I've been taking 1,200 mgs with my regular meds (seroquel + melatonin at night), I'm doing 1000% better and have even be able to stop taking my regular anti-depressants. 

It reduces cortisol in your brain and,  for me at least, manages my regular panic attacks. Have not had one since I started this (1 month so far).

Everyone's body chemistry is different. At minimum speak with your pharmacist before trying ashwagandha to ensure it doesn't negatively react with your existing meds.

But otherwise highly recommend. It's a life changing vitamin.
I took this in the morning and it immediately helped with my anxiety.  However, that night I had the most horrifying and vivid nightmare I had ever had.
Slowly noticed I was less stressed and calmer.
column14: 75 or over | 1 to less than 2 years

column6:
I have an extremely complex and stressful job. I also have a couple of compromised disks in my lower back and neck. These cause chronic pain. I also have chronic knee pain. 

When I get extremely stressed, it manifests itself as physical pain. I had long suspected it was cortisol and inflammation based. I am very disciplined with my diet and am in excellent health. 

I started taking ashwaganda on a regular basis to control the very unpleasant effects of stress and anxiety and it makes a HUGE difference in how I feel physically. 

If I skip my nightly dose, I am miserable the entire next day and am wrecked by the end of the day because of the pain I'm in. 

If you are dealing with chronic pain (not acute, but overall, throughout your body), I would try taking ashwaganda before bed. 

It does cause some fatigue, but also gives you a calm, relaxed feeling.

I started taking this about a month ago and at first i had little panic attacks here and there and than my panic attacks were gone and i thought well this is good but than i started to feel more depressed than ever feeling so negative having more anxiety feeling very tired mentally terrible nausea terrible headache sleeping problems as well as not being able to eat from the nausea and feeling excessively tired.I just stopped taking it about 4 days ago and everyday i feel worse probably from it still being in my system but i don't reccomend this if you have major depressive disorder ,panic disorder and GAD because it made me feel terrible i might update it i feel better but so far i still feel very brain fogged tired anxious and very depressed

I researched for something that would help with my stamina. I reviewed that information and decided to buy some ashwagandha the next time I saw it. I found the Goli nutrition brand, gummies, 300  mg. I take 1 in the morning before I take my dogs for a walk, before breakfast. My mind and body begin to wake up gradually over about 15 minutes. It is not a stimulant. It does not raise my blood pressure. I take another one about 2 or 3 in the afternoon. That's when my stamina begins to fade. I take another. Get up and move around and again my mind and body are able to have the stamina I need for the rest of the day. I almost never need to take a nap every afternoon as I had to before. I find I snack less, especially on simple carbs, that my body gets craving since it thought that would give me more energy. I actually feel more like eating healthier. I think 300 mg twice a day is probably best for me. I've also found that I can handle multiple, complicated, stressful tasks - without having so much anxiety I can't do anything. I plan on continuing to take it and have incorporated it into a very detailed medication/ supplement regimen. I hope I can take it regularly. It's made all the difference in my life.

I dont know if it helped me with stress anxety od depression, but i know the day i take it i have bad explosive diarhea. I tried it for few days and noticed the reason of the problem is this product...stoped..and problem stopped. The moment i took again the product same problem came back...
Amazing!!

CPTSD SINCE CHILDHOOD. I was on Paxil for 25 years but trauma break through was constant and eventually it interfered with my sleep. I slowly reduced Paxil and went through Paxil Withdraw syndrome. A night year for over a year to get this out of my system. I started Ashwagandha Conplex by Pattern Wellness and it truly works. My sleep is much improved and trauma flashbacks and somatic symptoms are 90% improved.

I take it for anxiety sometimes. Just a quarter teaspoon of an organic powder once a day. It has a mild but noticeable effect. I don't take it for very long, maybe a few months at a time, cycling off for long periods in between.

I have always been very skeptical of anything that can alter your mind or change things with your body but this has been a god send I have only been on this for 3 weeks and have it in my coffee every morning it started too help me with my ptsd after the first day my night terrors have gone I don't seem too have had one night terror or flashbacks since I've been taking this and it's helped me too deal with stressful situations  as well I seem too have taken the situation and thought properly about it and came up with solutions instead of just getting stressed like I have before I'd quite often get stressed and not even try too solve the problem just accept it but now I am actually getting through my problems I will recommend this too everyone I do believe that you can over do it though when I was having 3 a day I was having some serious bowel movements but been fine since I cut it down again
I had panic attacks after taking this, short of breath and extreme anxiety. Can't believe this thing is sold as a "supplement". It's ridiculous .

After about 8 years of trial and error with almost every antidepressant and antipsychotic on the market (or so it seemed) and very little if any lasting help, I decided to give ashwaganda* a try. (*Adeeva brand, and ashwaganda, 5% withanolides powder, is only one of the ingredients. Others include schisandra, rhodiola, B vitamins, magnesium, and zinc.) I have since been successfully able to wean psychiatric drug doses (which were harming my liver and causing other side effects). I sleep better, have less muscle pain and tingling, feel less anxious overall, can think more clearly, and no longer get episodes of hallucinations, extreme agitation or mental confusion. I've not noticed any side effects after more than 1 year of daily use. I started in slowly at 1 cap per day and have increased to 3/day. Would highly recommend Adeeva or a similar combination, to others seeking relief....although everyone's body may respond differently. The only drawback for me was the recommendation to take this product at least 2 hours apart from other medications or supplements, which was sometimes difficult with the rest of my protocol.

I've have been taking Ashwagandha for about a year and honestly, it has helped me with my stress and anxiety. The longer you take it the more you see the difference. I buy brand name ZHOU Ashwagandha. I feel like it helps me best, plus I tend to lean towards more organic stuff anyways.

I took one teaspoon of the ashwagandha powder to help me sleep.  The following day I had uniary incontenance.  Used depend and took again the 2nd night before bed.  Incontenance worse the next day.  Seems like it relaxed me too much.
Just taking one 300 mg dose caused super anxiety for me. I thought it could be something else & tried it again. No bueno. Tossed it out.

My anxiety attacks only strikes when I am worried of something, before,  now that I am taking Ashwagandha  I noticed my anxiety attacks got worse bec I keep having attacks for no reason at all.So I decided to stop taking t. It's not worth it.

BEen Taking Nature's Bounty Ashwagandha for A Week An My Sleep Has Been Improved I do Not Wake Up Groggy Anymore I Wake Up Feeling Refreshed And I Started To Dream Again. I Haven't Been Dreaming In So Long. And I Feel Less Tense From Stress Witch Is A Big Relief On My Mucsles
I became so paranoid an depressed and almost felt i was going crazy wth weird thoughts..

Horrible !! Only took on tablet for anxiety at night and I woke up in the morning feeling like I had been drugged .. groggy, headache, confusion and horrendous anxiety. Be careful I know it must work
For some but not for me !!
I sleep so much better and my mood is so much better when I take this. I feel less irritable and I sleep better.

Male, earlier 20s, non drug user and non smoker. Started use of chewable 350 mg root extract Ashwagandha gummies about a month ago for a boost in my strength training. First week of use was alright, i couldn't notice a major difference. Then for the next few weeks I used not as consistent until I started noticing a drop in mood and symptoms of depression. I have a history of depression but the taking of Ashwagandha I believe is the only thing that has triggered my change in mood

I went on this hoping it would calm me down as St John's Wort stimulated me a bit too much. Starting treatment with 1200mg of Ashwagandha gave me intrusive thoughts. After being on it for a few weeks I did notice I felt less anxious and more confident. However about a month on it I became very irritable and generally paranoid. I decided I was going to stay on it until spring after I tapered off of SJW. I took 1200mg a day and cut my dose in half for a week then stopped it completely a week after that. Irritability, panic attacks and feeling like I have the flu have been common for weeks after discontinuation. In my experience Ashwagandha has done more bad then good. If you are struggling with anxiety I would recommend talking to your doctor or looking elsewhere.

I was so excited when I purchased the 90ml bottle from chemist warehouse. I tried it and with complete honesty I nearly vomited. The taste was sooooo bad like a combination of cloves, arse and shit! Omg people DO NOT PUT god awful potion on your tongue. Just dont! But, I'm now putting it in a little juice and walla!!!!!!! Problem solved!

Absolutely amazing. Been using the Goli gummies for little over a week and let me tell you. I have never felt happier in my life, my sex drive has increased, my stress levels dropped significantly, I'm having more positive thoughts throughout the day, depressive thoughts are no more, and gym wise they have made me leaner and stronger no joke. Before taking them, I was stuck at 315 for deadlift and then recently I hit 405 then 2 days after hitting it for my 1RM I repped 405 out for 4 reps. 10/10 should buy.
T soes make one focused however,  I started experiencing pain in my eyes
The ashwaganda powder gave me paranoia. Now om in hospital because for mental health condition, the doctor told me is not recommended to take Them.

Took Ashwa gummies for anxiety for a month initially and slept very well but would wake up in the morning with brain zaps. Stopped taking them for some months, then started again and took them for about 4 months and started to feel very weak , faint and sleepy throughout the day and decided to stop taking them. I have since had very bad withdrawal symptoms. Having heart palpitations, anxiety has become worse, chest pains, feeling depressed, shacking for no reason, panicking for no reason and feeling faint usually around the same time I used to take them. It's been a week since I stopped taking them. Can't wait for them to get off my system.

I teach 6th grade in an urban middle school.  The stress level is immense and over the last couple of years, I gained quite a bit of weight.  I know that cortisol tends to send the fat to the belly so I thought I'd give this a try.  The label states that it helps maintain normal cortisol levels, among other things.  I started taking it about 6 months ago and the weight has been steadily coming off.  I am on a program of monitoring the kinds of foods I eat and being aware of what drives me to eat.  Combined, I have lost about 40 pounds.  I ran out a while back and decided to see if it was really doing anything for me.  After about two weeks off of it I noticed my weight plateaued, which is normal during weight loss.  I continued to eat as I had been and after another week, I noticed fat building up around my waist.  My weight was still sitting at the same measure and I started to think that maybe the pills were helping me with it.  So, I recently bought more and after a week my weight started moving down again and my waistline is getting better.  The weight loss is at a healthy rate of about half to 3/4 of a pound weekly and I feel better knowing my weight is moving down again, as well as my clothes fitting better.  I haven't noticed any negative effects, perhaps because I make sure I take my meds on a full stomach.  I do take meds for hypothyroidism and depression so, after reading some of the reviews, am going to cut down to one tablet a day instead of two.  We'll see how that works. The brand I've been using is from Costco.  It's put out by "youtheory" in 500mg capsules. No bad taste or weird mental issues.

I've been taking the goli ashwagandha gummies for months now. I started with one gummy a night which is half of what is suggested. Whether it was a placebo effect or not I swear from night one I slept better and longer than normal. For the last week or so I've been taking two gummies which is the suggested amount for a nights sleep as I've been extra stressed and it's been difficult falling asleep again. These really help me to calm down after a stressful day, would definitely recommend! They don't hurt my stomach AT ALL.

My wife and I are trying tonget pregnant and to hp reduce my stress levels. I tried Ashwagandha. It did help with my stress levels and i had great sleep. However. After about two weeks i started feeling ultra depressed and could have been classified as boarder line suicidal. I stopped taking Ashwagandha because i had no drive to take care of myself and after a few days i realized how much better I felt. Did it lower my stress levels yes but ill take some extra stress over being depressed. If you are going to try this. Just monitor yourself and if you see any mass shifts in the wrong direction, stop using it.
Caused brutal insomnia.  Wonder about possible interaction with Krill Oil and/or L-Tryptophan supplement I've been taking.  Discontinuing ashwagandha after the first dose.

Taking only 125 mg (Life Extension brand) at night to enhance my sleep. Very surprised how much deeper my sleep has been. Not really longer - still wake up fairly frequently but usually fall back asleep quickly. No side affects that I have noticed. Very pleased.

However, I started sweating profusely after about 30 minutes and after about two hours I woke up with rapid heartbeat and couldn't go back to sleep. Then all of a sudden I had the worst panic attack in years, problems breathing, legs were twitching. It lasted several hours.

My doctor told me that, since it's part of the nightshade familiy, it can work really bad for some (or even many) people. I will never use it again.

Like bad, I would wake up every single day feeling sick, in a dream like state, I would get ready to head to work or out with friends, or to the grocery or anywhere and I would just feel so anxious it physically made me sick. I actually ended up on the ER because I was having a panic attack and thought I was dying!! A co worker suggested ashwagandha, months ago. I was in the supermarket a few weeks ago walking to the check out ready to get the heck out of there and grabbed some ashwagandha gummies just thinking to myself why not try... I hopped in my vehicle and took 2 gummies... From what seemed that moment on I've felt 95% back to normal. None of the symptoms I mentioned above have been present at all since taking the supplement. My mind doesn't race anymore, I'm not dizzy or tense or anything!!!  I feel like they have saved my life.

Never had food allergies before using Ashwagandha it's the only newly exposed substance I've ingested. This substance must be reviewed by the FDA and managed to a much better degree.

The first thing I noticed after taking Ashwaganda is that I no longer had the feeling everyday that I've been crying. I've been struggling with anxiety and OCD for years, have taken Zoloft which helped but the side effects & weight gain bothered me. Lost weight as soon as I got off Zoloft. Also have tried bupropion and accidentally got temporarily hooked on TRAMADOL which is worse than rat poison. The local health food store owner recommended the Ashwaganda, and I've been taking Agobi brand maximum strength for a few months now and have had zero negative side effects. I do believe it has really worked for me and will continue to take this supplement.

I started taking ashwagandha for my anxiety as it had gotten so bad i needed to do something. After two weeks of taking ashwagandha (60 mg once a day) i felt great. Hardly any anxiety, sleeping well, totally back to normal. However, you can build up a tolerance to ashwagandha and that's what happened to me. After about 2 months of taking ashwagandha everyday it no longer worked for me and i began having panic attacks regularly and insomnia. i stopped taking the ashwagandha and my symptoms were worse than before. I was experiencing withdraw symptoms. Ashwagandha did work for me, but i recommend taking a smaller dose and not everyday to avoid building a tolerance.
This supplement made me nervous and very angry.

I decided to to visit a health store shortly after I re started jogging and training. Along with my purchase of protein, creatine and pre workout I purchased ashwaganda powder. It was purchased initially to help with anxiety and stress which was building up due to tense work and stress with my partner. I didnt even think about sex but with a daily routine of ashwaganda and excercise I noticed an increased level of libido, testosterone and sex drive. I have never been more attracted to my partner as to now and it feels good to fix what was missing in our relationship. I start my morning with water. Ashwaganda powder. Protein and creatine mixed with frozen berries and sometimes some yogurt. Dont expect instant results but stay consistent with 2 to 4 weeks and u will feel the benefits. I'm not sure what will happen once I stop using the ashwaganda as it has not been recommended for long term use.

After years of dealing with neuro lyme and ptsd related anxiety, this is the first thing that has worked for me. My anxiety is less and I'm sleeping through the night. I've also noticed some weight loss with it. I would recommend this to anyone looking to improve on all the topics I've mentioned in my review.

Under extreme stress, my knuckles buldged, my fingers twisted, Drs declared Arthritus & Fibromyalgia, wanted to give pain pills. I have residuals of ABI/TBI. Cannot take pain pills, they ruin cognitive function & Viox was killing my heart, other anti-infammatories were destroying my liver/liver pain & inflammation. So, I had aready stopped the Rx regimin &  begun taking turmeric, ginger, & pulverized afromomum, & Abhyanga treatments from a friend.These in combination with yoga and breathing meditations had begun to help my pain. But the stress was still there. The Ayurvedic Doc my friend sent me to added Ashwaghanda & suggested fasting/kitchadi meal 1 day week.  Ashwaghanda is amazing! My stress? I could take it in my tea or even just shake the bag, open, and inhale for emergency, like dealing with Ma's husband, and it wasn't a "high" just a sudden ability to focus and calm. I could go from shaking and crying to, "Right. That's his issue, not mine" in less than a minute. Clarity. That's what it does. Because if you can think, you can choose, and if you can choose, who would choose to be hurt by some horrible person cutting them down and blaming for stuff that isn't right, and on and on? Within 3 months, the knuckles returned to normal; my fingers uncurled, and I rarely feel pain now.

First I want to say that this is a natural remedy and unless you a seeing a natural path doctor don't stop taking any medications or take it with any other medication. It took almost two weeks for me to feel the effects of ashwagandha along with taking Valerian Root. The Valerian root helps me to stay asleep while the Ashwagandha stops the racing thoughts. It took me over a month to get the amounts and a better routine in place for everything to help me stay asleep. So far, some minor side effects, but not sleeping is 10x worse. Side effects so far have been getting drowsy starting 8:30pm and yesterday I thought it was my fathers birthday (very weird). I am also taking Cordychi to help with stress during the day time. I didn't think I was that stressed out, but I guess my body says otherwise.

I've been using Ashwagandha for about 2 months now. I started off using the YouTheory brand and now I am using the Organic India one. Personally I've had great results in many aspects of my life using it. My main use for it was to enhance sexual performance and it hasn't disappointed yet! But I have also had other positive effects. Libido is higher, workouts feel easier, I am not as hungry as usual, and I've had less racing thoughts throughout the day. I take it daily but I only consume at most 400mg a day. I have a feeling that the people who have experienced the worst side effects are dosing too much too quickly. Our bodies are all different and some of us might require more and some might require less to achieve a great effect. It doesn't hurt to start off with a low dosage everyday and be consistent with that. I haven't experienced any negative side effects from it, the only one would be a temporary drowsiness for about an hour once I consumed it. Overall I am very pleased with this supplement and I will continue to use it daily unless I develop any adverse effects in the long-term.

I have a panic attack disorder. I have a treatment for it which is working very well . Today I went to vons and decided to buy some ashwaghanda to try . I took one of the 2 gummies that were recommended. After a few minutes I could feel a panic attack coming . Haven't had one in months ....

I started taking this 4 days ago because I could not handle my anxiety anymore and wanted to try something natural before I told my doctor. My normal meds just include blood pressure pill, birth control,  aderall and stuff for my acid reflux. I decided to give this a try. I take them at night before I go to bed. I suddenly hopped online today because I was feeling.....different. I went to bed great last night but woke up at 230 am and could not get back to sleep. I woke up extremely itchy also. After 4am I said screw it and got up since my alarm would go off at 5. I have been wired. My coworkers asked why I was so twitchy and wired, asked if I was ok. I told them I felt like I was on drugs and didn't know what was going on! I was sooooo fricken itchy! But other than all that, I have had zero anxiety or panic attacks within the last 48 hours. I feel overly focused. Im going to ride it out and see what I feel in a week. Ive also lost my appetite (im ok with that) but can tolerate healthy snacking. I will take this weird feeling over the panic attacks and anxiety so as of right now, Im a fan. I just wish I could stop itching!

I popped a Spring Valley Ashwagandha Root Powder 800 mg tablet a few days ago. I have anxiety, depression, ADHD, PTSD and am on psychotropics for these conditions.  Within 3 hrs while shopping, I suddenly felt hot, broke out in a sweat, became nauseous, and w/out any control, threw up (which I had to hold in my mouth while getting to a bathroom).  Returned home just in time to throw up twice in my yard (back-to-back).  I felt very weak & sick, barely making it inside to the porcelain bowlâwhere I sat for >3 hrs alternating between puking & diarrhea.  I also couldn't think straight and my balance was off. I had ripped off my soaking wet clothes because my temperature regulation was off (hot).  Then toward the end of purging both ends, I became deeply chilled.  Drew a bubble bath, but my chills were so strong I had to re-up on the hot water; I felt so weak, after I toweled off, I used a heavy winter bathrobe for the chills, kinda stumbling around (my cats had waited 2 1/2 hrs to be fed).  Totally depleted of electrolytes after all thatâwhen I was suddenly overcome by thirst. Fortunately I had pediatric electrolyte popsicles from 5 yrs ago, where a series of vomiting episodes of unknown origin occurred.  By 11 pm, my stomach was hungry and I ate a small portion of mild food.  I'm quite sure my body over-reacted as an overdose of Ashwagandha root powder; the product itself is Lab-Certified and distributed by WalMart. I spent the next day recovering (from the intensity of purging) and returned to normal the following day.  I'm sure this dose was just too much for meâand all the glowing recommendations belie my experience.  I don't doubt that it helps multitudes of people.

I bought and took these several months ago, and stopped because I felt fine and didn't think I really needed them. The past few weeks or so, I have been very stressed at work, haven't slept well and neglected things I wanted to do around the house because I was so tired after work. Then I upped my coffee intake to try and keep up.  I soon started feeling really agitated, anxious, depressed and hopeless.  I was searching for a remedy. I decided to lay off the coffee, and all caffeine for the past few days, and I started taking these again (SV brand 800mg in the morning with a V8). I also took a "me" day off from work to relax and take care of all the things I neglected around my house.   Not sure what did the trick exactly, but I have slept so peacefully for the past 3 nights and I feel energized (not wired) and happy. I have had zero issues with stomach side effects.  I hope this state of mind lasts for a while. It's not a magic pill, you also need to make good choices and form good mental health habits with it,

This review is for the product Organic Ashwagandha by the company Himalaya. From the label it contains: 380mg ashwagandha powder (root); 280mg ashwagandha extract (root); and 10mg ashwagandha supercritical CO2 extract. I read about ashwagandha as having a therapeutic effect on anxiety in a controlled study and I thought it might help me. It is also supposed to give energy and claims to have an effect on adrenal function. I have been previously diagnosed with generalized anxiety disorder and social anxiety disorder, and I suspect panic disorder as well. I am a 32 year old female at 120lbs, not on any medications, and I do not smoke, drink, or take illegal drugs. I followed the directions and took 1 caplet before food just before my dinner. I felt strange within just a few minutes, beginning with an unpleasant lightheaded sensation which startled me, and I began to feel panicky -- on a scale of 1 to 10, around a 7 or 8 in severity. It felt like I had drank about 3 or 4 cups of coffee at once. I am familiar with my anxiety levels and this was noticeably more intense. To be more precise I actually felt "drugged." It took 2 hours to come down from this feeling of panic with some deep breathing. I lost my appetite but I could still force myself to eat. It was a very uncomfortable experience for me. Currently, about 4 hours later, I still feel some effects -- slight but noticeable dizziness, very small headache, tense muscles in head and neck, tiredness, and mild anxiety. I'm amazed that an OTC supplement could have such a potent psychoactive effect; I was not expecting this at all, much less the opposite of the promised antianxiolytic effects. Everyone reacts differently to therapeutics, but I would seriously urge anyone interested in trying ashwagandha to start much smaller than the recommended dose, especially if you have anxiety disorders or are "reactive" by nature. I think it's just bad body chemistry in my case and I will not be taking ashwagandha again.
started working immediately
It worked for a few months, but now I'm noticing itching, similar to an allergic reaction. Also some nausea. Guess I'll have to stop. It did lower my A1C a bit, and I am less stressed out.

I've been taking ashwagandha (600mg organic pills containing the root powder) daily in the morning for generalized anxiety, social anxiety, and to boost my thyroid. (Luckily my metabolism is low. If yours is naturally high, this plant may cause you trouble.) The dose on the bottle suggests twice a day, but I've read enough material stating an effective dose can be as low as 450 mg.  Immediately after taking the first dose I felt sleepy, but this only happened to me once. I have noticed that I have more energy (have started to exercise every other day), and work has been slightly more bearable. (the dose I am using takes the edges off my social anxiety, but I am still uncomfortable).    My appetite has increased a little, but I haven't experienced any negative sexual side effects.  I am not sure if this was because of the medication, but the first week I also created a schedule for my self to ensure that I get my tasks, work and personal care done in a timely fashion.  I don't take any other medication, except an occasional vitamin pill to fill any holes in my vegetarian diet.
helped with insomnia,anxiety,and arthritis.generally feeling of wellbeing.my daughterinlaw got pregnant after trying for over a year.
I use it regularly at half dose and it helps me lower my stress levels. Thanks to this I've reduced my bursts of anger about stupid stuff, because of my lockdown related stress.

These are drugs as well. They may be natural but still are drugs.

Worked immediately. I suffer from severe fatigue and focus issues. Both are seemingly gone. I am so happy that I started taking Ashwagandhaâ1300 mg nightly.

No rash or whelps just itch. Running water over my hands feels like what I might imagine shingles would be. (which I have also never had) It feels like a thousand pin pricks on each hand and the water hurts/stings. no broken skin anywhere on my hands. Took this to help with university-related anxiety. I tried SSRIs and they made my anxiety worse. After one week of taking 600mg twice a day, my tension headaches went away and I no longer had panic attacks. Before, I would have terrible heart pounding whenever I went to sleep but this has completely gone away. I am able to sleep at least 5 hours a night after three months taking two 600 mg. tablets  before breakfast and before dinner. The herb works best for me when I take it one hour before eating. Helps me with chronic pain.

KSM-66 Ashwagandha plus 500mg capsules from Wild Nutrition, One capsule per day at morning for severe anxiety and depression. Miracle cure for last 5-6 months. This started to work for me after first few weeks, but did really notice huge difference for my wellbeing after 2 months. Increases the brain function, physical wellbeing, highly increased libido(in a woman,lovely orgasmic days), anxiety and stress reduction, but also night time insomnia and daytime drowsiness and fatigue. It does not take the anxiety away totally, but has made me able to manage quite well when nothing un-expected or stressful happens. During the usage I have noticed that my tolerance and resilience is only growing and I'm starting to trust that I can manage what ever happens. I do not feel that depressed anymore. It protects you from little daily stresses, but if something major happens it is not enough to cushion you from the impact fully. Which is super positive as nobody wants to become a zombie feeling nothing, but actually build more resilience and experiences. Like, 4 weeks ago something very stressful happened to me, my anxiety peaked up very high and found new forms of torment (shopping in Supermarkets started to become difficult and panic inducing + physical symptoms were becoming a norm). I thought that I needed to have some conventional mental medication and that Ashwaganda wasn't enough anymore. However I was too afraid to eat the mental meds, because my anxiety (+previous bad side-effects experiences). So it left me in just to increase my Ashwagandha intake to 2 capsules per day. It was too much and I got pretty bad nausea for a week. I went back to one capsule per day and I feel really good again! Did my 2 workdays very well and seems that I can manage again. So even that you you might get your anxiety peaking up it feels that I recover back to my "normal" level after period of down and I feel more at ease about everything. Also attending weekly counselling last 3 months.

I have suffered from insomnia and was xanax dependant for years, but Ashwagandha (2 cap after dinner)helped me get rid of xanax, and now I am once again able to sleep soundly without any side effects or morning hangover.

This stuff works for anxiety, for me at least.  I have been taking it for about a month.  600 mg twice a day (2.5% withanolides).  I had been waking up early in the morning with severe anxiety, and that has abated significantly.  I started seeing a difference within days.  I still feel some anxiety in the morning, but it is not nearly as brutal.  I also feel happier during the day and I'm able to get things done much easier.  I'm at the point where I get nervous if I forget to take it, because I know it works.  One note - I did get nauseous in the beginning when I started it, but I powered through it and no longer experience that.  I take it without food so maybe my body had to adjust.  I would recommend it.  Just keep in mind that it's likely not going to eliminate your anxiety.  It should certainly help it though.

I started taking this after I had a nervous breakdown a few years ago. I hadn't slept more than like 15 hours in over a month, my heart wouldn't stop pounding, I was constantly nauseous, and anti-anxiety medication only made me worse. My mom had some thyroid supplements with adaptogens like this in it, and I had read that it helped balance out your cortisol levels (stress hormones), so I took one or two a day. The first night I managed to sleep about 3 hours, the second 6 hours, and by the third night, I had slept through the night. After that episode, I began alternating between an Ashwagandha supplement and a tulsi tea with Gotu Kola (another adaptogen). I did that pretty regularly for a month. Now I only take the Ashwagandha when I feel like I'm spiraling. The supplements I take are 450mg per pill. I only took one or two with a lot of water. Start with the lowest dose; don't immediately jump to a 1000mg pill. Everyone reacts differently to these things. If Ashwagandha doesn't work for you, try one of the other adaptogens. I take this on top of watching my diet (greasy food, alcohol, sugar, etc.), deep breathing, being proactive, and journaling. This supplement probably won't cure your anxiety, but it will keep it from getting out of hand.  *Also don't get it as a tea. It tastes awful.

My mom was having hallucinations at night, little people, wild animals, the room was changing - all things that were real to her. She doesn't wake up screaming about things that she had been dreaming about.  During the day she doesn't hallucinate.  If she does hallucinate about people and wild animals or the room changing, she takes 4 pellets of a homeopathic remedy, Helleborus Niger 30 C.    We also changed her diet.  We've cut out gluten - wheat, rice, barley, rye and Oats.  We also cut out all plants of the deadly night shade variety - tomatoes, eggplant, peppers and potatoes.      She excercises everday on a treadmill for 20 minutes at a slow speed.      She plays piano and works on jigsaw puzzles.    Ashwagandha is helping my mom to have much better days and nights.  I am finally sleeping and have the energy to care for my aging mom during the day.    Best of all, my mom is home with me and out of a nursing home!

This is a wonderful ânon drugâ but I recommend taking it at 9-10 PM. Otherwise you will be drowsy and sick the next day for a while. Maybe start with 1-3 mg. This is all I had. It works within an hour and then I can fall asleep shortly afterword.

The side affects beat NO SLEEP. Take the damn medicine, go to bed.

Honestly I don't understand how this is supposed to work.  I've struggled with sleep my whole life and have always been told to try it.  I have tried it many times for many years and it always keeps me up at night.  My most recent time I took it, it had the same affects as caffeine.  Yes, I may have felt a bit tired, but my body was jittery, my legs were restless, and my skin was suddenly itchy in random places.  Did not happen before I took it.  This has never helped me so I'm not sure if my body is different than others or if I'm not doing it right.
does anyone else experience severe abdominal pain after waking up?

I never could tolerate melotonin till i read you should be taking no more than HALF a milligram not five or 10mg that is so commonly on the pharmacy shelf! So I tried half a mg (sublingual) sometimes less for a month or more. I found at first it worked pretty good to get me to sleep and have 4 or 5 solid hours of it, it did make me almost immediately dizzy so I HAD to lay down. However after a while I soon began to get side effects. Literally almost everyone typically listed, next day dizziness, fatigue, headache, nausea, diarrhea, chills, low mood. At first I didn't realize it was the melatonin but then I stopped using it and the symptoms went away. Melatonin is a hormone and I believe after multiple experiences with it that its best to not play around with your hormones as you cant anticipate the potentially serious effects it can have on your body. I actually feel much safer taking a antihistamine to sleep.

I took Melatonin (Circadin ) 2 mg, before going to sleep as I am suffering from Insomnia. The first time it did not work at all and it kept me awake the whole night.  After a few weeks, I tried again, the same dosage,  and the same result. I checked all possible literature for adverse effect and could not find any article that suggests that melatonin cause alertness or wakefulness. I am not sure why the medication did not produce the results it claimed, instead of the opposite effect.
Been withdrawning from melatonin for 3 months now. Can't get off this stuff. So sick:. Fatigue depression insomnia  Took for 3 yrs. Down to 2 mg per night

It can sometimes help, but for me it seems to lose effectiveness after a few days.     First use of it got me back on a "normal" sleep cycle of night-midnight-early morning continuous six hours of sleep. A few days of this was wonderful, then the wakefulness at 2am started up again, and I'm back to where I was two weeks ago of 2 hours of sleep, 4-6 hours of wakefulness, and then a desperate need for sleep which I fall back into for 3 hours--VERY inconvenient for a stable work-life balance.     It's good for cycling through. Try it for a few days, then switch to something else.     I had vivid dreams the first night, and now it just seems normal to have them. I tend to remember the dreams when I wake up during the night. My sleep band that checks my sleep patterns shows I go into deep sleep during the first two hours, so maybe it's helping with that.

had chronic trouble with insomnia.  person told me about melatonin.  been taking it about 20-25 years now -- 3 mg 20 minutes before planning on going to bed for sleep (or short reading session in bed).  Problems with insomnia are now fairly rare.

Use Trophic Brand lmg.  Worked right from the start got best sleep ever.  Now not being produced I have tried other brand and they don't seem to work as well. Not sure if this is due to other ingredients included.  Wish it was still available esp. for travelling.

Taking for 1 month. Having SEVERE musculoskeletal pain & stiffness, bulging veins in my legs & purple toenails, extreme drowsiness, but still can't sleep, decreased mental function, depression, weight gain-I can't move due to pain & stiffness. This is a dangerous drug. Be careful
column41: musculoskeletal pain,stiffness,bulging veins,purple toenails,drowsiness,decreased mental function,depression,weight gain

I am a retired Pharmaceutical rep who sold Lunesta.  I decided to go all natural with my health regimen and tried benedryl 25 mg without a lot of success for sleep.  I tried Melatonin 5mg about 1/2 hour prior to climbing into bed. I was seriously doubtful due to my "pharma" background.  I love it and would recommend it to anyone.  Full night sleep and no drowsiness.  My husband takes it now too.
